text: Nothocestrum longifolium, the longleaf aiea, is a species of tree in the nightshade family, Solanaceae, that is endemic to Hawaii. It can be found in mesic and wet forests at elevations of on the islands of Maui, Molokai, Lānai, Oahu, Kauai. It is threatened by habitat loss. An analysis of the berries revealed them to be one of the most protein-rich of the fruits consumed by nestlings of Corvus hawaiiensis, the Hawaiian crow. ==References== Category:Physaleae Category:Endemic flora of Hawaii Category:Trees of Hawaii Category:Biota of Hawaii (island) Category:Biota of Kauai Category:Biota of Lanai Category:Biota of Maui Category:Biota of Molokai Category:Biota of Oahu Category:Near threatened plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Nothocestrum longifolium
